intro: Valeriana heyderi, commonly known as the African valerian, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Valeriana heyderi is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported calming properties.
